job description:
Associate Research Scientist

Seattle, WA

CORE JOB FUNCTIONS:

  • An experienced professional with a strong understanding of immunology and/or cancer biology.

  • Highly proficient in a wide-range of technical abilities.

  • Demonstrates independence in solving problems of diverse scope and complexity.

  • Will contribute to Client paradigm-shifting approaches to improve the clinical efficacy of T cell-based therapies.

  • Strong personal initiative, flexibility, and an innovative approach to problem-solving are required.


REQUIRED


  • Ability to culture primary and immortalized cell lines for a variety of immunologic assays (functional and phenotypic assessments, complex co-cultures, cytolytic activity).

  • Minimum 2 years of experience with cellular immunology and T cell functional assays including proliferation assays, ELISA, and multi-parameter (6+ color) flow cytometry.?

  • Familiarity with key principles of cellular and molecular immunology.

  • Demonstrated ability to work in a high paced team environment, meet deadlines, and prioritize work on multiple projects.




ADDITIONAL QUALIFICATIONS:


  • Experience with small molecule or biologic efficacy assays is a plus.

  • Excellent record keeping and electronic notebook maintenance.

  • Independence in data analysis and interpretation.

  • Outstanding written, visual, and oral communication skills.


EDUCATION/EXPERIENCE REQUIREMENTS:


  • Minimum 5 years of experience;

  • B.S. with 3-5+ or M.S. with 1-2+ years of hands on experience in a relevant research setting.
